title: Japan stocks lower at close of trade; Nikkei 225 down 0.41%
text:
© Reuters. Japan stocks lower at close of trade; Nikkei 225 down 0.41%

Investing.com – Japan stocks were lower after the close on Monday, as losses in the , and sectors led shares lower.

At the close in Tokyo, the fell 0.41%.

The best performers of the session on the were Pacific Metals Co., Ltd. (T: ), which rose 6.69% or 126.0 points to trade at 2010.0 at the close. Meanwhile, Tokyo Dome Corp. (T: ) added 3.39% or 35.0 points to end at 1068.0 and Astellas Pharma Inc. (T: ) was up 2.58% or 38.0 points to 1510.0 in late trade.

The worst performers of the session were DeNA Co Ltd (T: ), which fell 9.32% or 209.0 points to trade at 2034.0 at the close. Sumitomo Dainippon Pharma Co Ltd (T: ) declined 3.99% or 74.0 points to end at 1782.0 and Keio Corp. (T: ) was down 3.31% or 220.0 points to 6420.0.

Falling stocks outnumbered advancing ones on the Tokyo Stock Exchange by 2245 to 1217 and 237 ended unchanged.

Shares in Sumitomo Dainippon Pharma Co Ltd (T: ) fell to 52-week lows; down 3.99% or 74.0 to 1782.0.

The , which measures the implied volatility of Nikkei 225 options, was unchanged 0.00% to 18.10.

Crude oil for October delivery was up 0.11% or 0.06 to $55.16 a barrel. Elsewhere in commodities trading, Brent oil for delivery in November fell 0.03% or 0.02 to hit $59.23 a barrel, while the December Gold Futures contract rose 0.02% or 0.35 to trade at $1529.75 a troy ounce.

USD/JPY was down 0.02% to 106.27, while EUR/JPY fell 0.09% to 116.73.

The US Dollar Index Futures was down 0.03% at 98.833.
